page.title: 01South Cambridge Area Summary
page.content: The southern part of the city of Cambridge lies mostly below 15m on the east side of the valley of the river Cam, which meanders northward across alluvial gravels on underlying chalk. South Cambridge is served by 2 main roads, A10 from Royston and A604 from Haverhill, and a railway line with Cambridge station located south-east of the city centre.Within the built-up area the north-west is mainly occupied by University Colleges and Institut- ions, while the rest is 19th and early 20th century suburban residential development, with associated schools, churches & other services. Commercial zones are situated along the railway line and roads leading towards the city centre. Around the outskirts are open fields, mainly river pastures, ex- tending south to Trumpington village.
